'''Android 14''' is an upcoming major release of the [[Android (operating system)|Android mobile operating system]]. Android 14 Beta 1 was released on April 12, 2023.

== History ==
Android 14 (internally [[Code name|codenamed]] "Upside Down Cake"<ref>{{Cite web|last=Friedman|first=Alan|title=Google reveals one interesting bit of information about 2023's Android 14|url=https://www.phonearena.com/news/android-14-internal-code-upside-down-cake_id139802|access-date=2022-08-15|website=Phone Arena |language=en-US}}</ref>), was announced on February 8, 2023.
Android 14 was announced in an Android blog on February 8, 2023. A [[software release life cycle|developer preview]] was released immediately,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://developer.android.com/about/versions/14/overview|title=Android 14 Preview|date=2023-02-08|language=en}}</ref> as well as a [[Technology roadmap|roadmap]] with the dates of updates.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://developer.android.com/static/about/versions/14/images/timeline-desktop-en.svg|title=Timeline, milestones, and updates|work=Android|date=2023-02-08|language=en|access-date=2023-02-09}}</ref> This contained another developer preview, which was published on March 8,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://9to5google.com/2023/03/08/android-14-dp2-flash-notifications|title=Android 14 DP2 Flash Notifications|date=2023-03-08|language=en|access-date=2023-03-08}}</ref> as well as four monthly beta versions. The first beta was released on April 12th, which received a hotfix to Beta 1.1 on April 26th.<ref>{{Cite web|author=Dave Burke|url=https://android-developers.googleblog.com/2023/04/android-14-beta-1.html|title=Android 14 Beta 1|work=Android Developers Blog|date=2023-04-12|language=en|access-date=2023-04-12}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://developer.android.com/about/versions/14/release-notes|title=Android 14 Release Notes|work=Android Developers Blog|date=2023-04-26|language=en|access-date=2023-04-28}}</ref> The last version is scheduled to reach platform stability in July and general availability shortly thereafter.<ref name=":0" />

The beta versions are available for the Pixel 4a (5G), 5, 5a, 6, 6 Pro, 6a, 7 and 7 Pro.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://developer.android.com/about/versions/14/download|title=Factory images for Google Pixel |work=Android|date=2023-02-08|language=en|access-date=2023-02-09}}</ref>

== Features ==

* Satellite connectivity
* Predictive back gesture
* Integrated Health Connect
* Cloned Apps
* [[Software bloat|Bloatware]] finder

{{See also|Android version history#Android 14}}

Building on the new option added in [[Android 13]] to set languages individually for apps, this feature has been expanded and is easier to implement for developers. Furthermore, the new "Grammatical Inflection API" has been added to allow different salutations in languages when a message refers to the user in a gender-specific language.<ref name=":1">{{cite web|access-date=2023-02-09|date=2023-02-08|language=en|title=Features and APIs Overview|url=https://developer.android.com/about/versions/14/features|work=Android}}</ref><ref name=":2">{{cite web|access-date=2023-02-09|author=Cosmos|date=2023-02-08|language=en-US|title=Android 14 First Developer Preview Available Now|url=https://samlover.com/2023/02/08/android-14-first-developer-preview-available-now/}}</ref>

Compared to previous Android versions, Android 14 will offer the possibility to increase the font size up to 200% instead of 130% previously.<ref name=":1" />

Other innovations improve battery life by making internal processes more efficient for users.<ref name=":2" /> In addition, there is now the option to choose directly between energy-saving mode and extreme energy-saving mode.<ref name=":3">{{cite web|access-date=2023-02-12|author=((9to5Google))|date=2023-02-09|language=en|title=Android 14 Developer Preview 1: Top new features!|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xqoo1WlZxF4|work=YouTube}}</ref>

The screen time since the last full charge is now displayed in the battery settings. The battery consumption is shown separately from system and app applications. This feature was replaced with the launch of Android 12 by showing battery usage over the past 24 hours.<ref name=":3"/><ref>{{cite web|author=Aashish Singh|access-date=2023-02-12|date=2021-11-03|language=en-US|title=Android 12 ditched last full charge battery usage stats, shows past 24hrs|url=https://piunikaweb.com/2021/11/03/android-12-ditched-last-full-charge-battery-usage-stats-shows-past-24hrs/|work=PiunikaWeb}}</ref>

For devices with a larger screen, e.g. tablets, the [[taskbar]] is expanded in Android 14 and now shows the names of the pinned apps.<ref name=":3"/><ref>{{cite web|access-date=2023-02-12|author=Jens|date=2023-02-09|language=de-DE|title=Android 14: These are the most important innovations in the first developer preview of the new operating system|url=https://www.googlewatchblog.de/2023/02/android14-das-neuerungen-developer/|work=GoogelWatchBlog}}</ref>

The design language ''Material You'', already introduced in [[Android 12]] and supplemented in Android 13, gets revised default colors in Android 14.<ref name=":3"/>

In order to increase privacy, the user is given the opportunity to decide for themselves which images an app may access.<ref name=":4">{{cite web|access-date=2023-03-09|author=Dave Burke|date=2023-03-08|language=en|title=Android 14 Developer Preview 2|url=https://android-developers.googleblog.com/2023/03/android-14-developer-preview-2.html|work=Android Developers Blog}}</ref>

System-wide it is now possible to specify which temperature unit, [[degrees Fahrenheit]] or [[degrees Celsius]], should be used in applications.<ref name=":4" />

=== User experience ===
A predictive back gesture animation is shown to indicate when the back gesture will close or return to another app.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Update your app to support a predictive back gesture |url=https://developer.android.com/guide/navigation/predictive-back-gesture |access-date=2023-05-11 |website=Android Developers |language=en}}</ref>
